intro: Elsholtzia lungtangensis, commonly known as the Lungtang elsholtzia, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of China. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
